page.title: 02 - SOCIAL CONCERNS & EVENTS
page.content: One of the three ponds in the area, Chingford, was of concern to the local people in the early 1980s when its level was lowered. A channel was dug so that water could pass from Chingford pond to Burton pond without passing over the existing waterfall. The owners, St. Michaels School, were told that this was necessary because the calverts under the footpath were breaking up, and they were unable to meet the high cost of repairs. It has spoilt a picturesque spot, and there is concern for the fish and wildlife due to lack of water. In 1985 major dredging work lasting four months was carried out to Burton pond. Silt was pumped out from the bottom of the pond and deposited in a nearby field where the water could drain back into the pond. Workmen also cleared some of the ponds vegetation.
